user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of set_self_name:
```c
static void
set_self_name (int argc, char *const *argv)
{
  if ((argc >= 1) && (NULL != argv[0]))
  {
    const char *last_dir_sep;
    last_dir_sep = strrchr (argv[0], '/');
#ifdef _WIN32
    if (1)
    {
      const char *last_w32_dir_sep;
      last_w32_dir_sep = strrchr (argv[0], '\\');
      if ((NULL == last_dir_sep) ||
          ((NULL != last_w32_dir_sep) && (last_w32_dir_sep > last_dir_sep)))
        last_dir_sep = last_w32_dir_sep;
    }
#endif /* _WIN32 */
    if (NULL != last_dir_sep)
    {
      size_t name_len;
      name_len = strlen (last_dir_sep + 1);
      if ((0 != name_len) && ((sizeof(self_name) / sizeof(char)) > name_len))
      {
        strcpy (self_name, last_dir_sep + 1);
        return;
      }
    }
  }
  /* Set default name */
  strcpy (self_name, "perf_replies");
  return;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
name_len = strlen (last_dir_sep + 1);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No — not violated. last_dir_sep is obtained from strrchr(argv[0], ...) so, when non-NULL, it points into the NUL-terminated argv[0] string; last_dir_sep+1 points at a valid character position (possibly the NUL terminator) within that same object, so strlen(last_dir_sep + 1) cannot legally read past the bounds. The only way this could violate Rule 21.17 is if argv[0] were not a valid NUL-terminated string or last_dir_sep did not actually come from a valid buffer (e.g. invalid argv), which is outside the shown code’s normal assumptions.
